root_text.dn14:2.10.1: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto mahājanakāyaṁ sannipatitaṁ nānārattānañca dussānaṁ vilātaṁ kayiramānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:2.10.3: ‘kiṁ nu kho so, samma sārathi, mahājanakāyo sannipatito nānārattānañca dussānaṁ vilātaṁ kayiratī’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.10.5: ‘Tena hi, samma sārathi, yena so kālaṅkato tena rathaṁ pesehī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.10.6: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā yena so kālaṅkato tena rathaṁ pesesi.
root_text.dn14:2.10.7: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro petaṁ kālaṅkataṁ, disvā sārathiṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn14:2.10.9: ‘Eso kho, deva, kālaṅkato nāma. Na dāni taṁ dakkhanti mātā vā pitā vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā, sopi na dakkhissati mātaraṁ vā pitaraṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.10.10: ‘Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, ahampi maraṇadhammo maraṇaṁ anatīto;
root_text.dn14:2.10.11: mampi na dakkhanti devo vā devī vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā;
root_text.dn14:2.10.12: ahampi na dakkhissāmi devaṁ vā deviṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.10.13: ‘Tvañca, deva, mayañcamha sabbe maraṇadhammā maraṇaṁ anatītā;
root_text.dn14:2.10.14: tampi na dakkhanti devo vā devī vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā;
root_text.dn14:2.10.15: tvampi na dakkhissasi devaṁ vā deviṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.10.16: ‘Tena hi, samma sārathi, alaṁ dānajja uyyānabhūmiyā, itova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāhī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.10.17: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā tatova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāsi.
root_text.dn14:2.10.18: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro antepuraṁ gato dukkhī dummano pajjhāyati:
root_text.dn14:2.10.19: ‘dhiratthu kira, bho, jāti nāma, yatra hi nāma jātassa jarā paññāyissati, byādhi paññāyissati, maraṇaṁ paññāyissatī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā sārathiṁ āmantāpetvā etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:2.11.2: ‘kacci, samma sārathi, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā abhiramittha, kacci, samma sārathi, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā attamano ahosī’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.11.3: ‘Na kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā abhiramittha, na kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā attamano ahosī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.4: ‘Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, addasa kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.11.5: ‘Addasā kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto mahājanakāyaṁ sannipatitaṁ nānārattānañca dussānaṁ vilātaṁ kayiramānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:2.11.7: “kiṁ nu kho so, samma sārathi, mahājanakāyo sannipatito nānārattānañca dussānaṁ vilātaṁ kayiratī”ti?
root_text.dn14:2.11.9: “Tena hi, samma sārathi, yena so kālaṅkato tena rathaṁ pesehī”ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.10: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho ahaṁ, deva, vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā yena so kālaṅkato tena rathaṁ pesesiṁ.
root_text.dn14:2.11.11: Addasā kho, deva, kumāro petaṁ kālaṅkataṁ, disvā maṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:2.11.14: Na dāni taṁ dakkhanti mātā vā pitā vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā, sopi na dakkhissati mātaraṁ vā pitaraṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite”ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.15: “Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, ahampi maraṇadhammo maraṇaṁ anatīto;
root_text.dn14:2.11.16: mampi na dakkhanti devo vā devī vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā;
root_text.dn14:2.11.17: ahampi na dakkhissāmi devaṁ vā deviṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite”ti?
root_text.dn14:2.11.18: “Tvañca, deva, mayañcamha sabbe maraṇadhammā maraṇaṁ anatītā;
root_text.dn14:2.11.19: tampi na dakkhanti devo vā devī vā aññe vā ñātisālohitā, tvampi na dakkhissasi devaṁ vā deviṁ vā aññe vā ñātisālohite”ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.20: “Tena hi, samma sārathi, alaṁ dānajja uyyānabhūmiyā, itova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāhī”ti.
root_text.dn14:2.11.21: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho ahaṁ, deva, vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā tatova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāsiṁ.
root_text.dn14:2.11.22: So kho, deva, kumāro antepuraṁ gato dukkhī dummano pajjhāyati:
root_text.dn14:2.11.23: “dhiratthu kira, bho, jāti nāma, yatra hi nāma jātassa jarā paññāyissati, byādhi paññāyissati, maraṇaṁ paññāyissatī”’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.12.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumassa rañño etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.12.2: ‘mā heva kho vipassī kumāro na rajjaṁ kāresi, mā heva vipassī kumāro agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbaji, mā heva nemittānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ saccaṁ assa vacanan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.12.3: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa bhiyyoso mattāya pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi:
root_text.dn14:2.12.4: ‘yathā vipassī kumāro rajjaṁ kareyya, yathā vipassī kumāro na agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyya, yathā nemittānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ micchā assa vacanan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.13.1: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.
root_text.dn14:2.13.2: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bahūnaṁ vassānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasatānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasahassānaṁ accayena sārathiṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn14:2.13.3: ‘yojehi, samma sārathi, bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni, uyyānabhūmiṁ gacchāma subhūmidassanāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.13.4: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojetvā vipassissa kumārassa paṭivedesi:
root_text.dn14:2.13.5: ‘yuttāni kho te, deva, bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni,
root_text.dn14:2.13.7: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyāsi.
root_text.dn14:2.14.1: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto purisaṁ bhaṇḍuṁ pabbajitaṁ kāsāyavasanaṁ.
root_text.dn14:2.14.4: Sīsampissa na yathā aññesaṁ, vatthānipissa na yathā aññesan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.14.7: ‘Eso kho, deva, pabbajito nāma sādhu dhammacariyā sādhu samacariyā sādhu kusalakiriyā sādhu puññakiriyā sādhu avihiṁsā sādhu bhūtānukampā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.14.8: ‘Sādhu kho so, samma sārathi, pabbajito nāma, sādhu dhammacariyā sādhu samacariyā sādhu kusalakiriyā sādhu puññakiriyā sādhu avihiṁsā sādhu bhūtānukampā.
root_text.dn14:2.14.9: Tena hi, samma sārathi, yena so pabbajito tena rathaṁ pesehī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.14.10: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā yena so pabbajito tena rathaṁ pesesi.
root_text.dn14:2.14.11: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro taṁ pabbajitaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:2.14.13: sīsampi te na yathā aññesaṁ, vatthānipi te na yathā aññesan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.14.16: ‘Ahaṁ kho, deva, pabbajito nāma, sādhu dhammacariyā sādhu samacariyā sādhu kusalakiriyā sādhu puññakiriyā sādhu avihiṁsā sādhu bhūtānukampā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.14.17: ‘Sādhu kho tvaṁ, samma, pabbajito nāma sādhu dhammacariyā sādhu samacariyā sādhu kusalakiriyā sādhu puññakiriyā sādhu avihiṁsā sādhu bhūtānukampā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.15.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro sārathiṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn14:2.15.2: ‘tena hi, samma sārathi, rathaṁ ādāya itova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāhi.
root_text.dn14:2.15.3: Ahaṁ pana idheva kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissāmī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.15.4: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā rathaṁ ādāya tatova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāsi.
root_text.dn14:2.15.5: Vipassī pana kumāro tattheva kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbaji.
root_text.dn14:2.16.1: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni:
root_text.dn14:2.16.2: ‘vipassī kira kumāro kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.16.4: ‘na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha vipassī kumāro kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito.
root_text.dn14:2.16.5: Vipassīpi nāma kumāro kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissati, kimaṅgaṁ pana mayan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.16.6: Atha kho, so bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā vipassiṁ bodhisattaṁ agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitaṁ anupabbajiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:2.16.7: Tāya sudaṁ, bhikkhave, parisāya parivuto vipassī bodhisatto gāmanigamajanapadarājadhānīsu cārikaṁ carati.
root_text.dn14:2.17.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
root_text.dn14:2.17.2: ‘na kho metaṁ patirūpaṁ yohaṁ ākiṇṇo viharāmi, yannūnāhaṁ eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihareyyan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.17.3: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena eko gaṇamhā vūpakaṭṭho vihāsi, aññeneva tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni agamaṁsu, aññena maggena vipassī bodhisatto.
root_text.dn14:2.18.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa vāsūpagatassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.2: ‘kicchaṁ vatāyaṁ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca panimassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṁ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa,
root_text.dn14:2.18.3: kudāssu nāma imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṁ paññāyissati jarāmaraṇassā’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.4: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.5: ‘kimhi nu kho sati jarāmaraṇaṁ hoti, kiṁpaccayā jarāmaraṇan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.6: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.7: ‘jātiyā kho sati jarāmaraṇaṁ hoti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.8: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.9: ‘kimhi nu kho sati jāti hoti, kiṁpaccayā jātī’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.10: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.11: ‘bhave kho sati jāti hoti, bhavapaccayā jātī’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.12: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.13: ‘kimhi nu kho sati bhavo hoti, kiṁpaccayā bhavo’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.14: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.15: ‘upādāne kho sati bhavo hoti, upādānapaccayā bhavo’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.16: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.17: ‘kimhi nu kho sati upādānaṁ hoti, kiṁpaccayā upādānan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.18: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.19: ‘taṇhāya kho sati upādānaṁ hoti, taṇhāpaccayā upādānan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.20: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.21: ‘kimhi nu kho sati taṇhā hoti, kiṁpaccayā taṇhā’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.22: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.23: ‘vedanāya kho sati taṇhā hoti, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.24: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.25: ‘kimhi nu kho sati vedanā hoti, kiṁpaccayā vedanā’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.26: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.27: ‘phasse kho sati vedanā hoti, phassapaccayā vedanā’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.28: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.29: ‘kimhi nu kho sati phasso hoti, kiṁpaccayā phasso’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.30: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.31: ‘saḷāyatane kho sati phasso hoti, saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.32: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.33: ‘kimhi nu kho sati saḷāyatanaṁ hoti, kiṁpaccayā saḷāyatanan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.34: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.35: ‘nāmarūpe kho sati saḷāyatanaṁ hoti, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.36: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.37: ‘kimhi nu kho sati nāmarūpaṁ hoti, kiṁpaccayā nāmarūpan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.38: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.39: ‘viññāṇe kho sati nāmarūpaṁ hoti, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.18.40: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.18.41: ‘kimhi nu kho sati viññāṇaṁ hoti, kiṁpaccayā viññāṇan’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.18.42: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.18.43: ‘nāmarūpe kho sati viññāṇaṁ hoti, nāmarūpapaccayā viññāṇan’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.19.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.19.2: ‘paccudāvattati kho idaṁ viññāṇaṁ nāmarūpamhā, nāparaṁ gacchati.
root_text.dn14:2.19.3: Ettāvatā jāyetha vā jiyyetha vā miyyetha vā cavetha vā upapajjetha vā, yadidaṁ
root_text.dn14:2.19.4: nāmarūpapaccayā viññāṇaṁ, viññāṇapaccayā nāmarūpaṁ, nāmarūpapaccayā saḷāyatanaṁ, saḷāyatanapaccayā phasso, phassapaccayā vedanā, vedanāpaccayā taṇhā, taṇhāpaccayā upādānaṁ, upādānapaccayā bhavo, bhavapaccayā jāti, jātipaccayā jarāmaraṇaṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā sambhavanti.
root_text.dn14:2.19.6: ‘Samudayo samudayo’ti kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi, ñāṇaṁ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
root_text.dn14:2.20.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.2: ‘kimhi nu kho asati jarāmaraṇaṁ na hoti, kissa nirodhā jarāmaraṇanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.3: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.4: ‘jātiyā kho asati jarāmaraṇaṁ na hoti, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.5: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.6: ‘kimhi nu kho asati jāti na hoti, kissa nirodhā jātinirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.7: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.8: ‘bhave kho asati jāti na hoti, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.9: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.10: ‘kimhi nu kho asati bhavo na hoti, kissa nirodhā bhavanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.11: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.12: ‘upādāne kho asati bhavo na hoti, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.13: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.14: ‘kimhi nu kho asati upādānaṁ na hoti, kissa nirodhā upādānanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.15: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.16: ‘taṇhāya kho asati upādānaṁ na hoti, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.17: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.18: ‘kimhi nu kho asati taṇhā na hoti, kissa nirodhā taṇhānirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.19: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.20: ‘vedanāya kho asati taṇhā na hoti, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.21: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.22: ‘kimhi nu kho asati vedanā na hoti, kissa nirodhā vedanānirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.23: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.24: ‘phasse kho asati vedanā na hoti, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.25: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.26: ‘kimhi nu kho asati phasso na hoti, kissa nirodhā phassanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.27: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.28: ‘saḷāyatane kho asati phasso na hoti, saḷāyatananirodhā phassanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.29: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.30: ‘kimhi nu kho asati saḷāyatanaṁ na hoti, kissa nirodhā saḷāyatananirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.31: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.32: ‘nāmarūpe kho asati saḷāyatanaṁ na hoti, nāmarūpanirodhā saḷāyatananirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.33: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.34: ‘kimhi nu kho asati nāmarūpaṁ na hoti, kissa nirodhā nāmarūpanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.35: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.36: ‘viññāṇe kho asati nāmarūpaṁ na hoti, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.20.37: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.20.38: ‘kimhi nu kho asati viññāṇaṁ na hoti, kissa nirodhā viññāṇanirodho’ti?
root_text.dn14:2.20.39: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa yoniso manasikārā ahu paññāya abhisamayo:
root_text.dn14:2.20.40: ‘nāmarūpe kho asati viññāṇaṁ na hoti, nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho’ti.
root_text.dn14:2.21.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:2.21.3: nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho, nāmarūpanirodhā saḷāyatananirodho, saḷāyatananirodhā phassanirodho, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā nirujjhanti.
root_text.dn14:2.21.5: ‘Nirodho nirodho’ti kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi, ñāṇaṁ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
root_text.dn14:2.22.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassī vihāsi:
root_text.dn14:2.22.2: ‘iti rūpaṁ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
root_text.dn14:2.22.3: iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo;
root_text.dn14:2.22.4: iti saññā, iti saññāya samudayo, iti saññāya atthaṅgamo;
root_text.dn14:2.22.5: iti saṅkhārā, iti saṅkhārānaṁ samudayo, iti saṅkhārānaṁ atthaṅgamo;
root_text.dn14:2.22.6: iti viññāṇaṁ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti,
root_text.dn14:2.22.7: tassa pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassino viharato na cirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuccīti.
root_text.dn14:3.1.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:3.1.3: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:3.1.4: ‘adhigato kho myāyaṁ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
root_text.dn14:3.1.5: Ālayarāmā kho panāyaṁ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā.
root_text.dn14:3.1.6: Ālayarāmāya kho pana pajāya ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṁ idaṁ ṭhānaṁ yadidaṁ idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppādo.
root_text.dn14:3.1.7: Idampi kho ṭhānaṁ duddasaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.1.8: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.2.1: Apissu, bhikkhave, vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assutapubbā:
root_text.dn14:3.2.10: Itiha, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāya.
root_text.dn14:3.2.11: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññatarassa mahābrahmuno vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:3.2.12: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.2.13: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa purato pāturahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.3.1: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā dakkhiṇaṁ jāṇumaṇḍalaṁ pathaviyaṁ nihantvā yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:3.3.2: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ,
root_text.dn14:3.3.3: santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā; assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
root_text.dn14:3.4.1: Evaṁ vutte, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:3.4.5: “adhigato kho myāyaṁ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
root_text.dn14:3.4.6: Ālayarāmā kho panāyaṁ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā.
root_text.dn14:3.4.7: Ālayarāmāya kho pana pajāya ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṁ idaṁ ṭhānaṁ yadidaṁ idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppādo.
root_text.dn14:3.4.8: Idampi kho ṭhānaṁ duddasaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.4.9: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
root_text.dn14:3.4.10: Apissu maṁ, brahme, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assutapubbā:
root_text.dn14:3.4.19: Itiha me, brahme, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.5.2: tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:3.5.3: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ, santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.6.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brahmuno ca ajjhesanaṁ viditvā sattesu ca kāruññataṁ paṭicca buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokesi.
root_text.dn14:3.6.2: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
root_text.dn14:3.6.3: Seyyathāpi nāma uppaliniyaṁ vā paduminiyaṁ vā puṇḍarīkiniyaṁ vā appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakānuggatāni anto nimuggaposīni. Appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni samodakaṁ ṭhitāni. Appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakā accuggamma ṭhitāni anupalittāni udakena.
root_text.dn14:3.6.4: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento addasa satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
root_text.dn14:3.7.1: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
root_text.dn14:3.7.12: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
root_text.dn14:3.7.17: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā: ‘katāvakāso khomhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammadesanāyā’ti vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
root_text.dn14:3.8.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:3.8.2: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ,
root_text.dn14:3.8.4: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn14:3.8.5: ‘ayaṁ kho khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasanti paṇḍitā viyattā medhāvino dīgharattaṁ apparajakkhajātikā.
root_text.dn14:3.8.6: Yannūnāhaṁ khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa, tissassa ca purohitaputtassa paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, te imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissantī’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.9.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—bodhirukkhamūle antarahito bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā kheme migadāye pāturahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.9.2: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dāyapālaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn14:3.9.3: ‘ehi tvaṁ, samma dāyapāla, bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi—
root_text.dn14:3.9.4: vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.9.5: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, dāyapālo vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭissutvā bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:3.9.6: ‘vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati; so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.10.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā niyyiṁsu. Yena khemo migadāyo tena pāyiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.10.2: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu. upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.11.1: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
root_text.dn14:3.11.2: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
root_text.dn14:3.11.3: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
root_text.dn14:3.11.5: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
root_text.dn14:3.11.6: evameva khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.12.1: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.12.3: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
root_text.dn14:3.12.4: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca.
root_text.dn14:3.12.5: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.13.1: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto, tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.13.2: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
root_text.dn14:3.13.3: saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
root_text.dn14:3.13.4: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.14.1: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni:
root_text.dn14:3.14.2: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati.
root_text.dn14:3.14.3: Khaṇḍo ca kira rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.14.5: ‘na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā.
root_text.dn14:3.14.6: Khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissanti, kimaṅgaṁ pana mayan’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.14.7: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā nikkhamitvā yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.15.1: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
root_text.dn14:3.15.2: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.

root_text.dn14:3.15.5: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
root_text.dn14:3.15.6: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.16.1: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.16.3: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
root_text.dn14:3.16.4: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
root_text.dn14:3.16.5: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.17.1: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipāṇasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ, alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.17.2: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
root_text.dn14:3.17.3: saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
root_text.dn14:3.17.4: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.18.1: Assosuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni purimāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni:
root_text.dn14:3.18.2: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, dhammañca kira desetī’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.18.3: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.19.1: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
root_text.dn14:3.19.2: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
root_text.dn14:3.19.3: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
root_text.dn14:3.19.5: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
root_text.dn14:3.19.6: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipabbajitasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.20.1: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.20.3: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.

root_text.dn14:3.21.1: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.21.2: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
root_text.dn14:3.21.3: saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
root_text.dn14:3.21.4: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.22.1: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahābhikkhusaṅgho paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.22.2: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.22.3: ‘mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, yannūnāhaṁ bhikkhū anujāneyyaṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.22.4: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
root_text.dn14:3.22.6: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
root_text.dn14:3.22.7: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
root_text.dn14:3.22.9: Api ca channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā”’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.23.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa purato pāturahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.23.2: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn14:3.23.4: Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, anujānātu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhū:
root_text.dn14:3.23.5: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
root_text.dn14:3.23.7: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
root_text.dn14:3.23.8: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro”ti.
root_text.dn14:3.23.9: Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.23.11: Idaṁ vatvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
root_text.dn14:3.24.1: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito bhikkhū āmantesi:
root_text.dn14:3.24.2: ‘idha mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.24.3: “mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.24.5: caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;

root_text.dn14:3.25.4: Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.25.6: caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
root_text.dn14:3.25.9: santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāroti.
root_text.dn14:3.25.10: Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma, yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.

root_text.dn14:3.26.1: ‘Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, caratha cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
root_text.dn14:3.26.3: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
root_text.dn14:3.26.4: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
root_text.dn14:3.26.6: Api ca, bhikkhave, channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.26.7: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yebhuyyena ekāheneva janapadacārikaṁ pakkamiṁsu.
root_text.dn14:3.27.1: Tena kho pana samayena jambudīpe caturāsīti āvāsasahassāni honti.
root_text.dn14:3.27.2: Ekamhi hi vasse nikkhante devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.27.5: pañcannaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.27.12: ekassa vassassa accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.27.15: samayo dāni bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamituṁ pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.27.16: Atha kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū appekacce sakena iddhānubhāvena appekacce devatānaṁ iddhānubhāvena ekāheneva bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamiṁsu pātimokkhuddesāyāti.
root_text.dn14:3.28.1: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bhikkhusaṅghe evaṁ pātimokkhaṁ uddisati:
root_text.dn14:3.29.1: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhikkhave, samayaṁ ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.
root_text.dn14:3.29.2: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
root_text.dn14:3.29.3: ‘na kho so sattāvāso sulabharūpo, yo mayā anāvutthapubbo iminā dīghena addhunā aññatra suddhāvāsehi devehi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.5: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ subhagavane sālarājamūle antarahito avihesu devesu pāturahosiṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.29.6: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.29.7: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.8: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.9: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.10: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.11: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
root_text.dn14:3.29.12: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.29.13: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ. root_text.dn14:3.29.14: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
root_text.dn14:3.29.15: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.16: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
root_text.dn14:3.29.17: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.29.18: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.29.19: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti …
root_text.dn14:3.30.1: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.30.2: ‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
root_text.dn14:3.30.3: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā khattiyakule uppanno.
root_text.dn14:3.30.5: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
root_text.dn14:3.30.7: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.30.8: Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.30.9: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
root_text.dn14:3.30.10: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.30.11: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
root_text.dn14:3.30.13: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.

root_text.dn14:3.31.15: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.31.16: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
root_text.dn14:3.31.17: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
root_text.dn14:3.31.18: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.31.19: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
root_text.dn14:3.31.20: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
root_text.dn14:3.31.21: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.31.22: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ sikhī bhagavā …pe…
root_text.dn14:3.31.23: te mayaṁ, mārisā, sikhimhi bhagavati tasmiññeva kho, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ vessabhū bhagavā …pe…

root_text.dn14:3.32.1: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn14:3.32.2: ‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
root_text.dn14:3.32.3: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā, khattiyakule uppanno.
root_text.dn14:3.32.5: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
root_text.dn14:3.32.7: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.

root_text.dn14:3.32.11: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
root_text.dn14:3.32.12: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
root_text.dn14:3.32.14: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi, evaṁ pabbajjā, evaṁ padhānaṁ, evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.

root_text.dn14:3.33.3: Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipi.

root_text.dn14:3.33.6: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.

translation_text.dn14:1.17.0: 2. What’s Normal For One Intent on Awakening
translation_text.dn14:1.17.1: When Vipassī, the being intent on awakening, passed away from the host of joyful gods, he was conceived in his mother’s womb, mindful and aware.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.3: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of joyful gods, he is conceived in his mother’s womb.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.4: And then—in this world with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.5: Even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the luminosity of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.6: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: ‘So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!’
translation_text.dn14:1.17.7: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.8: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.9: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, four godlings approach to guard the four quarters, so that no human or non-human or anyone at all shall harm the being intent on awakening or his mother.
translation_text.dn14:1.17.10: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.18.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she becomes naturally ethical. She refrains from killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.
translation_text.dn14:1.18.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.19.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she no longer thinks of men in a sexual way, and she cannot be violated by a man of lustful intent.
translation_text.dn14:1.19.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.20.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she obtains the five kinds of sensual stimulation and amuses herself, supplied and provided with them.
translation_text.dn14:1.20.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.21.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her. She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue. And she sees the being intent on awakening in her womb, whole in his major and minor limbs, not deficient in any faculty.
translation_text.dn14:1.21.2: Suppose there was a beryl gem that was naturally lustrous, eight-faceted, well-worked, transparent, clear, and unclouded, endowed with all good qualities. And it was strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.
translation_text.dn14:1.21.3: And a person with clear eyes were to take it in their hand and examine it: ‘This beryl gem is naturally lustrous, eight-faceted, well-worked, transparent, clear, and unclouded, endowed with all good qualities. And it’s strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.’
translation_text.dn14:1.21.4: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her. She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue. And she sees the being intent on awakening in her womb, whole in his major and minor limbs, not deficient in any faculty.
translation_text.dn14:1.21.5: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.22.1: It’s normal that, seven days after the being intent on awakening is born, his mother passes away and is reborn in the host of joyful gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.22.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.23.1: It’s normal that, while other women carry the infant in the womb for nine or ten months before giving birth, not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She gives birth after exactly ten months.
translation_text.dn14:1.23.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.24.1: It’s normal that, while other women give birth while sitting or lying down, not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She only gives birth standing up.
translation_text.dn14:1.24.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.25.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, gods receive him first, then humans.
translation_text.dn14:1.25.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.26.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, before he reaches the ground, four godlings receive him and place him before his mother, saying: ‘Rejoice, O Queen! An illustrious son is born to you.’
translation_text.dn14:1.26.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.27.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.
translation_text.dn14:1.27.2: Suppose a jewel-treasure was placed on a cloth from Kāsi. The jewel would not soil the cloth, nor would the cloth soil the jewel.
translation_text.dn14:1.27.4: Because of the cleanliness of them both.
translation_text.dn14:1.27.5: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.
translation_text.dn14:1.27.6: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.28.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, two showers of water appear from the sky, one cool, one warm, for bathing the being intent on awakening and his mother.
translation_text.dn14:1.28.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.29.1: It’s normal that, as soon as he’s born, the being intent on awakening stands firm with his own feet on the ground. Facing north, he takes seven strides with a white parasol held above him, surveys all quarters, and makes this dramatic proclamation: ‘I am the foremost in the world! I am the eldest in the world! I am the first in the world! This is my last rebirth; now there’ll be no more future lives.’
translation_text.dn14:1.29.2: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.30.1: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, then—in this world with its gods, Māras, and divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.30.2: Even in the boundless gloom of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the luminosity of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.30.3: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: ‘So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!’
translation_text.dn14:1.30.4: And this ten-thousandfold galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.
translation_text.dn14:1.30.5: This is normal in such a case.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.0: 3. The Thirty-Two Marks of a Great Man
translation_text.dn14:1.31.1: When Prince Vipassī was born, they announced it to King Bandhumā,
translation_text.dn14:1.31.2: ‘Sire, your son is born! Let your majesty examine him!’
translation_text.dn14:1.31.3: When the king had examined the prince, he had the brahmin soothsayers summoned and said to them,
translation_text.dn14:1.31.5: When they had examined him they said to the king,
translation_text.dn14:1.31.6: ‘Rejoice, O King! An illustrious son is born to you. You are fortunate, so very fortunate, to have a son such as this born in this family!
translation_text.dn14:1.31.7: For the prince possesses the thirty-two marks of a great man. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.8: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.9: He has the following seven treasures:
translation_text.dn14:1.31.10: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the householder, and the commander as the seventh treasure.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.11: He has over a thousand sons who are valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of his enemies.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.12: After conquering this land girt by sea, he reigns by principle, without rod or sword.
translation_text.dn14:1.31.13: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.1: And what are the marks which he possesses?
translation_text.dn14:1.32.8: On the soles of his feet there are thousand-spoked wheels, with rims and hubs, complete in every detail.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.11: His hands and feet are tender.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.12: He has serried hands and feet.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.13: The tops of his feet are arched.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.14: His calves are like those of an antelope.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.15: When standing upright and not bending over, the palms of both hands touch the knees.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.16: His private parts are covered in a foreskin.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.17: He is golden colored; his skin shines like lustrous gold.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.18: He has delicate skin, so delicate that dust and dirt don’t stick to his body.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.19: His hairs grow one per pore.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.20: His hairs stand up; they’re blue-black and curl clockwise.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.21: His body is tall and straight-limbed.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.22: He has bulging muscles in seven places.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.23: His chest is like that of a lion.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.24: He is filled out between the shoulders.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.25: He has the proportional circumference of a banyan tree: the span of his arms equals the height of his body.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.28: His jaw is like that of a lion.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.34: He has the voice of the Divinity, like a cuckoo’s call.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.36: He has eyelashes like a cow’s.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.37: Between his eyebrows there grows a tuft, soft and white like cotton-wool.
translation_text.dn14:1.32.38: The crown of his head is like a turban.
translation_text.dn14:1.33.1: These are the thirty-two marks of a great man that the prince has. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.
translation_text.dn14:1.33.2: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch.
translation_text.dn14:1.33.7: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.’
translation_text.dn14:1.33.8.0: 4. How He Came to be Known as Vipassī
translation_text.dn14:1.33.9: Then King Bandhumā had the brahmin soothsayers dressed in unworn clothes and satisfied all their needs.
translation_text.dn14:1.34.1: Then the king appointed nursemaids for Prince Vipassī.
translation_text.dn14:1.34.2: Some suckled him, some bathed him, some held him, and some carried him on their hip.
translation_text.dn14:1.34.3: From when he was born, a white parasol was held over him night and day, with the thought,
translation_text.dn14:1.34.4: ‘Don’t let cold, heat, grass, dust, or damp bother him.’
translation_text.dn14:1.34.5: He was dear and beloved by many people,
translation_text.dn14:1.34.6: like a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus.
translation_text.dn14:1.34.8: He was always passed from hip to hip.
translation_text.dn14:1.35.1: From when he was born, his voice was charming, graceful, sweet, and lovely.
translation_text.dn14:1.35.2: It was as sweet as the song of a cuckoo-bird found in the Himalayas.
translation_text.dn14:1.36.1: From when he was born, Prince Vipassī had the power of clairvoyance which manifested as a result of past deeds, by which he could see for a league all around both by day and by night.
translation_text.dn14:1.37.1: And he was unblinkingly watchful, like the gods of the thirty-three.
translation_text.dn14:1.37.2: And because it was said that he was unblinkingly watchful, he came to be known as ‘Vipassī’.
translation_text.dn14:1.37.3: Then while King Bandhumā was sitting in court, he’d sit Prince Vipassī in his lap and explain the case to him.
translation_text.dn14:1.37.4: And sitting there in his father’s lap, Vipassī would thoroughly consider the case and draw a conclusion using a logical system.
translation_text.dn14:1.37.5: So this was all the more reason for him to be known as ‘Vipassī’.
translation_text.dn14:1.38.1: Then King Bandhumā had three stilt longhouses built for him—one for the winter, one for the summer, and one for the rainy season,
translation_text.dn14:1.38.2: and provided him with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
translation_text.dn14:1.38.3: Prince Vipassī stayed in a stilt longhouse without coming downstairs for the four months of the rainy season, where he was entertained by musicians—none of them men.
translation_text.dn14:2.1.1: Then, after many years, many hundred years, many thousand years had passed, Prince Vipassī addressed his charioteer,
translation_text.dn14:2.1.2: ‘My dear charioteer, harness the finest chariots. We will go to a park and see the scenery.’
translation_text.dn14:2.1.3: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied the charioteer. He harnessed the chariots and informed the prince,
translation_text.dn14:2.1.6: Then Prince Vipassī mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out for the park.
translation_text.dn14:2.2.1: Along the way he saw an elderly man, bent double, crooked, leaning on a staff, trembling as he walked, ailing, past his prime.
translation_text.dn14:2.2.3: ‘My dear charioteer, what has that man done?
translation_text.dn14:2.2.4: For his hair and his body are unlike those of other men.’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.5: ‘That, Your Majesty, is called an old man.’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.6: ‘But why is he called an old man?’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.7: ‘He’s called an old man because now he has not long to live.’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.8: ‘But my dear charioteer, am I liable to grow old? Am I not exempt from old age?’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.9: ‘Everyone is liable to grow old, Your Majesty, including you. No-one is exempt from old age.’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.10: ‘Well then, my dear charioteer, that’s enough of the park for today. Let’s return to the royal compound.’
translation_text.dn14:2.2.11: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ replied the charioteer and did so.
translation_text.dn14:2.2.12: Back at the royal compound, the prince brooded, miserable and sad:
translation_text.dn14:2.2.13: ‘Curse this thing called rebirth, since old age will come to anyone who’s born.’
translation_text.dn14:2.3.1: Then King Bandhumā summoned the charioteer and said,
translation_text.dn14:2.3.2: ‘My dear charioteer, I hope the prince enjoyed himself at the park? I hope he was happy there?’
translation_text.dn14:2.3.3: ‘No, Your Majesty, the prince didn’t enjoy himself at the park.’
translation_text.dn14:2.3.4: ‘But what did he see on the way to the park?’
translation_text.dn14:2.3.5: And the charioteer told the king about seeing the old man and the prince’s reaction.
translation_text.dn14:2.4.2: ‘Prince Vipassī must not renounce the throne. He must not go forth from the lay life to homelessness. And the words of the brahmin soothsayers must not come true.’
translation_text.dn14:2.4.3: To this end he provided the prince with even more of the five kinds of sensual stimulation,
translation_text.dn14:2.4.5: with which the prince amused himself.
translation_text.dn14:2.5.1: Then, after many thousand years had passed, Prince Vipassī had his charioteer drive him to the park once more.
translation_text.dn14:2.6.1: Along the way he saw a man who was sick, suffering, gravely ill, collapsed in his own urine and feces, being picked up by some and put down by others.
translation_text.dn14:2.6.3: ‘My dear charioteer, what has that man done?
translation_text.dn14:2.6.4: For his eyes and his voice are unlike those of other men.’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.5: ‘That, Your Majesty, is called a sick man.’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.6: ‘But why is he called a sick man?’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.7: ‘He’s called a sick man; hopefully he will recover from that illness.’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.8: ‘But my dear charioteer, am I liable to fall sick? Am I not exempt from sickness?’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.9: ‘Everyone is liable to fall sick, Your Majesty, including you. No-one is exempt from sickness.’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.10: ‘Well then, my dear charioteer, that’s enough of the park for today. Let’s return to the royal compound.’
translation_text.dn14:2.6.11: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ replied the charioteer and did so.

translation_text.dn14:2.6.13: ‘Curse this thing called rebirth, since old age and sickness will come to anyone who’s born.’

translation_text.dn14:2.10.3: ‘My dear charioteer, why is that crowd making a bier?’
translation_text.dn14:2.10.4: ‘That, Your Majesty, is for someone who’s departed.’
translation_text.dn14:2.10.5: ‘Well then, drive the chariot up to the departed.’
translation_text.dn14:2.10.6: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ replied the charioteer, and did so.
translation_text.dn14:2.10.7: When the prince saw the corpse of the departed, he addressed the charioteer,
translation_text.dn14:2.10.9: ‘He’s called departed because now his mother and father, his relatives and kin shall see him no more, and he shall never again see them.’
translation_text.dn14:2.10.10: ‘But my dear charioteer, am I liable to die? Am I not exempt from death?
translation_text.dn14:2.10.11: Will the king and queen and my other relatives and kin see me no more?
translation_text.dn14:2.10.12: And shall I never again see them?’
translation_text.dn14:2.10.13: ‘Everyone is liable to die, Your Majesty, including you. No-one is exempt from death.
translation_text.dn14:2.10.14: The king and queen and your other relatives and kin shall see you no more,
translation_text.dn14:2.10.15: and you shall never again see them.’
